meanings.definition: The hairs on the back of an animal's neck that stand up when it is angry or frightened.
meanings.sent1: The dog's hackles rose as it sensed danger nearby.
meanings.sent2: The cat's hackles were raised when it saw a stranger approaching.
meanings.sent3: Seeing the vacuum cleaner made the dog's hackles stand on end.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence sent shivers down his spine, raising his hackles.
meanings.sent5: The hackles of the wolf stood out like a warning sign in the moonlight.

meanings.definition: A feeling of anger or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: Her hackles rose when she heard the unfair criticism.
meanings.sent2: His hackles were up after the argument with his friend.
meanings.sent3: The slow service at the restaurant really got her hackles up.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise outside was like a constant assault on his hackles.
meanings.sent5: The hackles of injustice burned within him, fueling his determination to make things right.
